title: The X Factor Israel (season 3)
text:
<a href="The%20X%20Factor%20Israel">The X Factor Israel</a> is the <a href="Israel">Israel</a>i version of the <a href="British%20television">British television</a> music competition "<a href="The%20X%20Factor%20%28TV%20series%29">The X Factor</a>". The third season started its run on Thursday, October 18, 2017 on <a href="Reshet">Reshet</a> network's <a href="Channel%202%20%28Israel%29">Channel 2</a> and aired in prime time. After October 31, 2017, it was aired on <a href="Reshet%2013">Reshet 13</a>.
Judges and hosts.
Israeli fashion model <a href="Bar%20Refaeli">Bar Refaeli</a> hosted the third season. Contrary to most other versions of the "<a href="The%20X%20Factor%20%28TV%20series%29">X Factor</a>" where the judges panels was a mixture of singers and music industry figures, the Israeli version was composed entirely of musicians. The judges panel for the first season was composed of the rock singer <a href="Rami%20Fortis">Rami Fortis</a>, the pop singer-songwriter and composer <a href="Moshe%20Peretz">Moshe Peretz</a>, the pop and R&B singer <a href="Shiri%20Maimon">Shiri Maimon</a>, and the pop singer <a href="Ivri%20Lider">Ivri Lider</a>. Fortis forfeited the judging role, and got replaced by the Israeli rapper <a href="Subliminal%20%28rapper%29">Subliminal</a>.
Finalists.
